text: Marcus Terentius Varro Lucullus (c. 116 â€“ soon after 56 BC), younger brother of the more famous Lucius Licinius Lucullus, was a supporter of Lucius Cornelius Sulla and consul of ancient Rome in 73 BC. As proconsul of Macedonia in 72 BC, he defeated the Bessi in Thrace and advanced to the Danube and the west coast of the Black Sea. In addition, he was marginally involved in the Third Servile War (a.k.a. Spartacus' War). Category:Roman people Category:Roman generals Category:110s BC births Category:50s BC deaths
title: Marcus Terentius Varro Lucullus
